Sentencas: Direct internal reforming solid oxide fuel cells (DIR-SOFCs) are economically viable devices for power generation, while their reliability requires further improvement.
Titulo: Nonlinear model predictive control of direct internal reforming solid oxide fuel cells via PDAE-constrained dynamic optimization

Sentencas: Advanced process control can effectively facilitate the long-term operation of SOFCs with high efficiency and safety.
Titulo: Nonlinear model predictive control of direct internal reforming solid oxide fuel cells via PDAE-constrained dynamic optimization

Sentencas: DIR-SOFCs exhibit complex coupling effect and a high degree of nonlinearity, making it worthwhile to embed high -quality dynamic models including spatial distributions into nonlinear model predictive control (NMPC).
Titulo: Nonlinear model predictive control of direct internal reforming solid oxide fuel cells via PDAE-constrained dynamic optimization

Sentencas: A two -layer control architecture aiming for rapid load tracking and thermal management with high economic efficiency is designed for planar DIRSOFCs, containing a set point optimizer and an NMPC controller based on the distributed parameter model expressed by partial differential-algebraic equations (PDAE).
Titulo: Nonlinear model predictive control of direct internal reforming solid oxide fuel cells via PDAE-constrained dynamic optimization

Sentencas: PDAE-constrained dynamic optimization problems are solved in the NMPC controller to seek optimal control strategies, considering safety constraints about the maximum temperature gradient and physical constraints of actuators.
Titulo: Nonlinear model predictive control of direct internal reforming solid oxide fuel cells via PDAE-constrained dynamic optimization

Sentencas: The high-fidelity one-dimensional PDAE model is validated through steady and dynamic simulations, and the optimal steady-state distributions are analyzed under three power demands.
Titulo: Nonlinear model predictive control of direct internal reforming solid oxide fuel cells via PDAE-constrained dynamic optimization

Sentencas: Behaviors of the closed -loop system under power demand step-up and step-down scenarios are investigated to demonstrate the effectiveness of the designed control scheme.
Titulo: Nonlinear model predictive control of direct internal reforming solid oxide fuel cells via PDAE-constrained dynamic optimization

Sentencas: The proposed NMPC controller can efficiently realize rapid load tracking, maintain good thermal management, and reduce the transition time, with minor steady-state errors and acceptable real-time performance.
Titulo: Nonlinear model predictive control of direct internal reforming solid oxide fuel cells via PDAE-constrained dynamic optimization
